title: Varus mid is taking over lcs
body: I believe Varus mid is getting unbalanced, he can poke better than xerath and ziggs (once he gets blue it is insane) while also being able to take structures down easily ('cause he is ad of course). He's not that promped to be an easy gank when he takes {{summoner:4}} {{summoner:1}} and also has his E to slow and his ult to lockdown any threat. I think he is outclassing by far the regular poke mid mages, Varus shouldn't be playing in the midlane! Remember when riot nerfed  {{champion:127}}when she was taking over top? and also {{champion:117}}  and {{champion:69}} ? I think Varus is no exception and should be rebalanced. Really, I find Varus mid unfun, specially on lcs, boring, really, and when you see him take down a {{champion:69}} 's 35% health with one Q that also goes through minions, you know there is something wrong, {{champion:101}} can't do that.

replies.body:
We're keeping an eye on Varus mid, there's certainly the possibility his Q might get a bit overbearing once he's got enough CDR/Mana/AD. He is immobile though, and lacks a strong disengage on a basic cooldown. That vulnerability means he avoids some of the issues we've seen with Jayce, Nid, Ziggs etc in the past.

In terms what position champions play in anywhere they're healthy's fine by us. In Varus' particular case we were actually aiming for mid lane play originally as a primary position for him, even going so far as to include that in the champion spotlight: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=twiHstUjNkY 

That didn't end up working out at the time, didn't have the tuning on him right, nor some of the itemization he currently benefits from, but must admit it's been nice to see it getting play finally.

Why should a champion be balanced around only one lane? Unless this champion is unbalanced here, I see no reason to gut him to make him unplayable here.

Also, there is a difference between ADC Varus and an AD Caster Varus.

ADC = AD **C**aster

wtf are you trying to say?

ADC = AD Carry

which is different from an AD caster.

Varus can be built as an ADC (with Infinity Edge, Phantom Dancer/Statikk Shiv, and items that are common to ADCs) OR as an AD Caster (with Muramana, Last Whisper, Black Cleaver, items that are common to casters that don't make use of attack speed)

Both builds are different, and have a different playstyle, despite being similar and being both AD. ADC Varus has better sustained damage, better 1x1 potential, and is slighty better at taking towers (due to superior attack speed). AD Caster Varus has better poke, can spam his spells more (due to purchasing Muramana - ADC Varus CAN'T poke because he will run out of mana quickly), does more damage with his spells, and tends to have better all-around potential due to not being the main attack damage carry.

Granted, Lulu and Varus are two different champions.

Lulu has... different problems that forced Rito to nerf her when she got popularized in different lanes. 

As much as it pains me to say, certain supports are just not allowed to be "too" strong. Many traditional supports (not utility mages, although some can be played as decent supports) are balanced to be effective without much gold. After all, a one second stun is a one second stun no matter what level or gold income you have. Problem is when people figure out that if you give a utility support the income of a laner, they have an edge over certain champions designed to solo lane.

I'm not quite sure about Lulu's history, but I can see why she would be toned down a bit. It was kind of like pre-rework Soraka, where the lane wouldn't be very interactive (poke Soraka? She heals herself. She spams Q all day. She silences you if you try to kill her. She gives herself mana to spam Q more. Neither of you are going to die. Neither of you are going to do much of anything). Lulu is a bit more interactive than that, not having to be reworked at all, but Riot might have had similar reasons.

In other words, champions with high utility (supports) sometimes get toned down so they don't out-class other champions. 

Varus, on the other hand, doesn't have nearly the same amount of cc as Lulu. He has poke, some damage steroids, a slow, and a root. That's much healthier for a solo laner than instant-cast hard cc, as hard as it is to say. Varus isn't unhealthy to lane against, so there's no reason to force him to go bot lane.
